Introduction to Economics (undergraduate)
Fundamentals of Microeconomics (undergraduate)

title: Alexander Grawe
text:
I am a PhD student at the Berlin School of Economics and DIW Berlin. I hold an MPhil from Tinbergen Institute in Amsterdam and a B.Sc. from the Free University of Berlin.
My research interests are in applied microeconomics with a focus on labor, education, and inequality.

title: CV
text: You can download a PDF copy of my CV here.

title: Research
text: My research interestes lie in applied microeconomics with a focus on labor economics, the economics of education, and economic inequality.

title: Research
text:
Work in Progress
Sibling Spillovers in Education, with Maximilian Bach & Jan Marcus.

title: BSoE & GC Internal Workshop 2025
text:
We are happy to invite you to the Berlin School of Economics and DIW Graduate Graduate Center Internal Workshop for first-year PhD students.

Time and Location
The workshop will take place on 28 April 2025, starting at 17:00. After presentations, food and drink will be provided. It will take place at
Elinor Ostrom Hall
DIW Berlin
Mohrenstrasse 58
10117 Berlin.


Registration
This is a chance to present masters theses, work in progress, reasearch ideas, or topics of interest to fellow PhD students. Presentations will be around 20 minutes (including discussion).
Please register here by 20 April 2025 if you would like to attend or present.


Program
The program will be available some days before the workshop.

Workshop Organizers: Alexander Grawe, Maria Kagkeli, Andreea Stoica, and Fan Yin
